Comments_List: We developed grammar, vocabulary, and cultural skills in the Brazilian Portuguese context.
The class was disorganized at times but the teacher was very caring and hard working.

It was very fun and engaging. I think I would have benefited from slightly more traditional teaching: I.e. prioritising a bit more the grammar, vocab etc.

I think I was one of the only one who did not speak Spanish before taking the class, so it was really difficult when "explanations" of exercises, grammar etc. were in Portuguese rather than English - though talking to other students it seems that at least for the ones speaking Spanish this was less of a problem.
Strengths: fun class environment and engaging prompts for in class conversation. Course could be improved with more structured grammar lessons and vocabulary quizzes.
It was a wonderful experience but disorganized at times. Definitely take if you're interested in Portuguese.
Yes, absolutely. It was fun and engaging and I learned a lot.
